description: The harbor porpoise is a small coastal cetacean commonly found in temperate and subpolar waters. It prefers shallow seas and is one of the most frequently observed cetaceans in European waters.
The striped dolphin is a fast-swimming pelagic species typically found in warm and temperate offshore waters. It is known for its distinctive body stripes and highly social behavior.
The short-beaked common dolphin is a highly social species occurring in large groups. It is widely distributed in temperate and tropical waters and often associated with productive ocean regions.
The common bottlenose dolphin is a highly intelligent and adaptable species found in both coastal and offshore habitats. It is one of the best-studied cetaceans worldwide.
The fin whale is a large baleen whale commonly found in deep offshore waters. It feeds primarily on small schooling fish and krill and undertakes long seasonal migrations.
The common minke whale is a small and agile baleen whale species. It is widely distributed across temperate and polar waters and frequently observed in the North Atlantic.
This taxonomic group represents dolphins of the genus Delphinus. These dolphins are typically found in productive offshore regions and are known for their energetic behavior.
The white-beaked dolphin is a cold-water species commonly found in the North Atlantic. It prefers shelf and slope waters and is often observed in small groups.
The humpback whale is known for its acrobatic breaching behavior and complex songs. It migrates long distances between high-latitude feeding areas and low-latitude breeding grounds.
The sperm whale is the largest toothed whale and an extreme deep-diving species. It primarily feeds on squid and inhabits deep ocean environments.
The killer whale is a top marine predator found in all oceans. It exhibits complex social structures and diverse feeding strategies depending on the population.
The long-finned pilot whale is a highly social species that forms strong group bonds. It is commonly found in temperate and subpolar deep waters.
This group includes dolphins known for their spinning leaps out of the water. They are typically found in warm offshore waters and form large social groups.
Odontoceti is a suborder of cetaceans characterized by the presence of teeth. These species rely heavily on echolocation for navigation and hunting.
The blue whale is the largest animal ever known to have lived on Earth. It feeds almost exclusively on krill and inhabits deep ocean waters.
Risso's dolphin is a robust dolphin species with a heavily scarred body. It primarily feeds on squid and prefers deep offshore waters.
The northern bottlenose whale is a deep-diving beaked whale species. It is mainly found in cold North Atlantic waters and feeds on deep-sea squid.
Cuvier's beaked whale is known for record-breaking dive depths among marine mammals. It typically inhabits deep offshore and slope waters.
The Atlantic white-sided dolphin is a fast and energetic species found in cold temperate waters. It is commonly observed in the North Atlantic.
This subspecies of harbor porpoise is endemic to the Black Sea. It inhabits coastal waters and is considered vulnerable due to human impacts.
The sei whale is a fast-swimming baleen whale typically found in offshore waters. It feeds on plankton and small fish and migrates seasonally.
This subspecies of bottlenose dolphin is native to the Black Sea. It occupies coastal habitats and is adapted to lower salinity conditions.
The beluga whale is a white-colored cetacean adapted to Arctic and sub-Arctic environments. It is known for its vocal behavior and social nature.
Beaked whales are a family of deep-diving cetaceans that are rarely observed at the surface. They primarily feed on deep-sea squid.
The short-finned pilot whale is a tropical and subtropical species. It forms tight social groups and feeds mainly on squid.
The false killer whale is a large oceanic dolphin species. It is a powerful predator that inhabits warm offshore waters.
